hidden.description: Whether to hide the picture from the resume.

url.description: The URL to the picture to display on the resume. Must be a valid URL with a protocol (http:// or https://).

size.description: The size of the picture to display on the resume, defined in points (pt).

rotation.description: The rotation of the picture to display on the resume, defined in degrees (Â°).

aspectRatio.description: The aspect ratio of the picture to display on the resume, defined as width / height (e.g. 1.5 for 1.5:1 or 0.5 for 1:2).

borderRadius.description: The border radius of the picture to display on the resume, defined in points (pt).

borderColor.description: The color of the border of the picture to display on the resume, defined as rgba(r, g, b, a).

borderWidth.description: The width of the border of the picture to display on the resume, defined in points (pt).

shadowColor.description: The color of the shadow of the picture to display on the resume, defined as rgba(r, g, b, a).

shadowWidth.description: The width of the shadow of the picture to display on the resume, defined in points (pt).

picture.description: Configuration for photograph displayed on the resume

name.description: The full name of the author of the resume.

headline.description: The headline of the author of the resume.

email.description: The email address of the author of the resume.

phone.description: The phone number of the author of the resume.

location.description: The location of the author of the resume.

url.description: The URL to show as a link. Must be a valid URL with a protocol (http:// or https://).

label.description: The label to display for the URL. Leave blank to display the URL as-is.

website.description: The website of the author of the resume.

id.description: The unique identifier for the custom field. Usually generated as a UUID.

icon.description: The icon to display for the custom field. Must be a valid icon name from @phosphor-icons/web icon set, or an empty string to hide. Default to '' (empty string) when unsure which icons are available.

text.description: The text to display for the custom field.

link.description: If the custom field should be a link, the URL to link to.

customFields.description: The custom fields to display on the resume.

basics.description: Basic information about the author, such as name, email, phone, location, and website

title.description: The title of the summary of the resume.

columns.description: The number of columns the summary should span across.

hidden.description: Whether to hide the summary from the resume.

content.description: The content of the summary of the resume. This should be a HTML-formatted string.

summary.description: Summary section of the resume, useful for a short bio or introduction

hidden.description: Whether to hide the item from the resume.

name.description: The name of the reference, or a note such as 'Available upon request'.

position.description: The position or job title of the reference.

url.description: The URL to show as a link. Must be a valid URL with a protocol (http:// or https://).

label.description: The label to display for the URL. Leave blank to display the URL as-is.

website.description: The website or LinkedIn profile of the reference, if any.

phone.description: The phone number of the reference.

description.description: The description of the reference. Can be used to display a quote, a testimonial, etc. This should be a HTML-formatted string.

items.description: The items to display in the custom section. Items follow the schema of the section type.

customSections.description: Custom sections of the resume, such as a custom section for notes, etc.

template.description: The template to use for the resume. Determines the overall design and appearance of the resume.

sidebarWidth.description: The width of the sidebar column, defined as a percentage of the page width.

fullWidth.description: Whether the layout of the page should be full width. If true, the main column will span the entire width of the page. This means that there should be no items in the sidebar column.

main.description: The items to display in the main column of the page. A string array of section IDs (experience, education, projects, skills, languages, interests, awards, certifications, publications, volunteer, references, profiles, summary or UUIDs for custom sections).

sidebar.description: The items to display in the sidebar column of the page. A string array of section IDs (experience, education, projects, skills, languages, interests, awards, certifications, publications, volunteer, references, profiles, summary or UUIDs for custom sections).

pages.description: The pages to display in the layout.

layout.description: The layout of the resume. Determines the structure and arrangement of the sections on the resume.

enabled.description: Whether to enable custom CSS for the resume.

value.description: The custom CSS to apply to the resume. This should be a valid CSS string.

css.description: Custom CSS to apply to the resume. Can be used to override the default styles of the template.

gapX.description: The horizontal gap between the sections of the page, defined in points (pt).

gapY.description: The vertical gap between the sections of the page, defined in points (pt).

marginX.description: The horizontal margin of the page, defined in points (pt).

marginY.description: The vertical margin of the page, defined in points (pt).

format.description: The format of the page. Can be 'a4', 'letter' or 'free-form'.

locale.description: The locale of the page. Used for displaying pre-translated section headings, if not overridden.

hideIcons.description: Whether to hide the icons of the sections.

page.description: The page settings of the resume. Determines the margins, format, and locale of the resume.

icon.description: The icon to display for the custom field. Must be a valid icon name from @phosphor-icons/web icon set, or an empty string to hide. Default to '' (empty string) when unsure which icons are available.

type.description: The type of the level design. 'hidden' will hide the level design, 'circle' will display a circle, 'square' will display a square, 'rectangle' will display a rectangle, 'rectangle-full' will display a full rectangle, 'progress-bar' will display a progress bar, and 'icon' will display an icon. If 'icon' is selected, the icon to display should be specified in the 'icon' field.

primary.description: The primary color of the design, defined as rgba(r, g, b, a).

text.description: The text color of the design, defined as rgba(r, g, b, a). Usually set to black: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1).

background.description: The background color of the design, defined as rgba(r, g, b, a). Usually set to white: rgba(255, 255, 255, 1).

design.description: The design settings of the resume. Determines the colors, level designs, and typography of the resume.

fontFamily.description: The family of the font to use. Must be a font that is available on Google Fonts.

fontWeights.description: The weight of the font, defined as a number between 100 and 900. Default to 400 when unsure if the weight is available in the font.

fontSize.description: The size of the font to use, defined in points (pt).

lineHeight.description: The line height of the font to use, defined as a multiplier of the font size (e.g. 1.5 for 1.5x).

body.description: The typography for the body of the resume.

fontFamily.description: The family of the font to use. Must be a font that is available on Google Fonts.

fontWeights.description: The weight of the font, defined as a number between 100 and 900. Default to 400 when unsure if the weight is available in the font.

fontSize.description: The size of the font to use, defined in points (pt).

lineHeight.description: The line height of the font to use, defined as a multiplier of the font size (e.g. 1.5 for 1.5x).

heading.description: The typography for the headings of the resume.

typography.description: The typography settings of the resume. Determines the fonts and sizes of the body and headings of the resume.

notes.description: Personal notes for the resume. Can be used to add any additional information or instructions for the resume. These notes are not displayed on the resume, they are only visible to the author of the resume when editing the resume. This should be a HTML-formatted string.

metadata.description: Metadata for the resume, such as template, layout, typography, etc. This section describes the overall design and appearance of the resume.
